meanings.sent1: During the prelection, the professor explained the topic in detail.
meanings.sent2: The prelection on history was informative and engaging.
meanings.sent3: The prelection about dinosaurs made the students roar with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her prelection was a beacon of knowledge in the sea of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The prelection painted a vivid picture of the past events.

meanings.definition: The act of delivering a lecture or discourse.
meanings.sent1: His prelection captivated the audience with its clarity.
meanings.sent2: The prelection by the guest speaker was well-received.
meanings.sent3: The prelection turned a sleepy crowd into an attentive audience.
meanings.sent4: In her prelection, she wove words into a tapestry of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The prelection left a lasting impression on the listeners.
